result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam W Ryan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adam W Ryan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adam W Ryan was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam W Ryan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's copy of Notice of Certification returned undeliverable - Unable to Forward per USPS - REMAILED

ADDRESS INFO for Adam W Ryan
Current: 2110 Sherri Ln #8, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494-6421 United States  (Effective: 12-27-2016)
Prior: 3013 State Highway 73, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495

Defendant Adam W Ryan in court with attorney John B. Selsing.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendeee states that this is the defendant's motion to amend the JOC to allow electronic monitoring.  Atty Selsing agrees and states motion.  Atty Hendee objects to the motion.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant's Motion is denied.

Defendant Adam W Ryan in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Possession; removing the repeater.  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1.  Atty Selsing agrees.
BY THE COURT: Court amends Ct. 1 to Misd. Possession; removing the repeater. 
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty fo the amended Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Selsing asks the court to follow the joint recommendation and asks for 60 days to report to jail.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court orders 20 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before January 15, 2015 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May serve in Wood County
Good Time
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
  Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in January

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Defendant Adam W Ryan in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states parties had a pretrial and requests matter be set for plea.  BY THE COURT:  Set plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Adam W Ryan in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR770 & 15TR771 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Selsing; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Selsing agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Selsing states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Selsing enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
15TR770 & 15TR771 are to track w/15CF45 per DA's Office

Defendant Adam W Ryan in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR770 & 771 tracking with:
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant wants to get counsel.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court finds probable cause.  Court questions the defendant regarding time limits.  Defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Prelim.
Time limits waived.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
